citations.narrative:
Two separate primary enclosures each housing one Siberian Husky puppy both have excessive rust on the front door and
door frames of each enclosure. This rust does not allow these surfaces to be readily cleaned and sanitized. Surfaces that
can not be properly cleaned and sanitized can be a health risk for the animals contained in the enclosures as they can
allow for disease transmission. These rusting areas must be replaced or resurfaced to allow for effective cleaning and
sanitization.
Correct by: 8-9-2023.

Two separate primary enclosures each housing one Siberian Husky puppy both measure 26 X 21 inches. Each dog
measures approximately 18 inches from the base of its tail to the tip of its nose. These dogs require four square feet be
provided by their primary enclosures. The enclosures provide 3.8 square feet. These puppies need to be housed in
enclosures that provide the minimum amount of floor space that they require. Inadequate space may have a detrimental
effect on the animal’s ability to make normal postural and social adjustments with adequate freedom of movement.
Correct by: 8-8-2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
